title: Means of Hypergeometric Distributions
body: In one of its Spring catalogs, L.L. Bean® advertised footwear on $$29$$ of its $$192$$ catalog pages. Suppose we randomly survey $$20$$ pages. We are interested in the number of pages that advertise footwear. Each page may be picked at most once. Let X $$=$$ the number of pages that advertise footwear.
